Awards

  • Hollywood The Golden Age

  • Dramas
  • Awards
  • Information

Some Like It Hot received 6 awards: Golden Globes Award For Best Actress,Marilyn Monroe. Golden Globe Award For Best Actor, Jack Lemmon. Accademy Award For Best Costume Design,Orry-Kelly. BAFTA Award For Best Foreign Actor,Jack Lemmon. Writers Guild Of America Award For Best Written Comedy,Billy Wilder. PGA Hall Of Fame- Motion Pictures,Billy Wilder.


The Seven Year Itch received 1 award: Golden Globes Award For Best Actor,Tom Ewell.


Sabrina received 3 awards: Golden Globes Award For Best Screenplay,Ernest Lehman. Academy Award For Best Costume Design,Edith Head. Writers Guild Of America Award For Best Written Comedy,Billy Wilder and Ernest Lehman.


Roman Holiday received 6 awards: Academy Awards For Best Actress,Audrey Hepburn. Academy Awards For Best Story,Dalton Trumbo. Golden Globes Awards For Best Actress- Motion Pictures,Drama,Audrey Hepburn. Academy Awards For Best Costume Design,Edith Head. BAFTA Awards For Best British Actress,Audrey Hepburn. Writers Guild Of America Award For Best Written Comedy,Ian MecLellan Hunter,John Dighton.


Bus Stop received 1 award: National Board of Review,USA.


An American In Paris received 8 awards: Academy Awards For Best Picture,Arthur Freed. Academy Awards For Best Cinematography,John Alton and Alfred Gilks. Academy Awards For Best Production Design,Cedric Gibbons and Edwin B Willis. Academy Awards For Best Costume Design,Orry-Kelly,Irene Sharaff and Walter Plunkett. Golden Globes Award For Best Motion Picture,Arthur Freed. Academy Awards For Best Original Musical,Johnny Green and Saul Chaplin. Academy Awards For Best Story and ScreenPlay,Alan Jay Lerner. Writers Guild Of America Award For Best Written Musical,Alan Jay Lerner.


It happened One Night received 7 awards: Academy Awards For Best Picture, Columbia Picture. Academy Awards For Best Actor, Clark Gable. Academy Awards For best Actress, Claudette Colbert. Academy Awards For Best Director, Frank Capra. Academy Awards For Best Writing Adapted Screenplay, Robert Riskin. PGA Hall Of Fame Motion Picture, Frank Capra and Harry Cohn. Medal of the Compagnia italiana Grandi Alberghi, Frank Capra.


Singing in the rain received 4 awards: Golden Globe Award For Best Actor Motion Picture Musical or Comedy, Donald O'Connor. Writers Guild of America Award For Best Written Musical, Betty Comden and Adolph Green.


Breakfast at Tiffany's received 4 awards: Academy Awards For Best Original Music Score, Henry Mancini. David Di Donatello For Best Foreign Actress, Audrey Hepburn. Picture Animal Top Star of The Year, Orangey. Writers Guild of America Award For Best Written Comedy, George Axelrod.


Rebel without a cause received 2 awards: Most Promising Newcomer-Female, Natalie Wood. National Film Preservation Board,USA, Nation Film Registry.


Giant received 4 awards: Academy Awards For Best Director, George Stevens. Golden Globe Award For Best New Star of the year-actress, Carrol Baker. David di Donatello For Best Foreingn Producer, Jack L.Warner. Direct Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directing-Feature film.


Casablanca received 3 awards: Academy Awards For Best Picture, Warner Bros. Academy Awards For Best Director, Michael Curtiz. Academy Awards For Best Writing Adapted Screenplay, Howard E.Koch and Julius J.Epstein.


Gone With The Wind received 8 awards: Academy Awards For Best Picture, Selznick International Pictures. Academy Awards For Best Actress, Vivien Leigh. Academy Awards For Best Actress in a supporting role, Hattie McDaniel. Academy Awards For Best Director, Victor Fleming. Academy Awards For Best Writing Adapted Screenplay, Sidney Howard. Academy Awards For Best Cinamatography, Ernest Haller and Ray Rennahan. Academy Awards For Best Production Design, Lyle R.Wheeler. Academy Awards For Best Film editing, Hal C.Kem and James E.Newcorn. Academy Honorary Award, William Comer Menzies. New York Film Critics Circle Award For Best Actress, Vivien Leigh. People's choice Award for favorite All-Time Motion Picture. Satellite Award For Best Overall DVD in 2009, Warner Home Video.


Love is a Many-Splendored Thing received 3 awards: Academy Awards For Best Original Music Score, Alfred Newman. Academy Awards For Best Costume Design, Charles LeMaire. Golden Globe For Best Film Promoting International Understanding, Henry King.
